descriptionNullable:
The dataset is one of the historical sales of supermarket company which has recorded in 3 different branches for 3 months data.
[Visit Data Source](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/aungpyaeap/supermarket-sales) # But, I've changed the database a little Since I'll use this data only in a visualization work, I've a freedom to change the database to make my job easier and more visually appealing. **Note:** This data for the learning purposes, not for decision making.

### **Add four years to the date** Actually and for the first time, I worked with SQL not pandas. ```sql UPDATE superSales SET Order_date = DATEADD(YEAR, 4, Order_date) WHERE YEAR(Order_date) = 2019 ```

### **Add cities** Before: each branch has a unique identifier A, B, C Now: besides this id we also have a city name to be more clear about where the branch live. ```sql Update superSales set City = case Branch WHEN 'A' THEN 'Plymouth' WHEN 'B' THEN 'Bristol' WHEN 'C' THEN 'Glasgow' END; select City from superSales; ```

### The final product * [SuperDashboard on Streamlit](https://super-dashboard.streamlit.app/) * [Source Code on GitHub](https://github.com/mohamedyosef101/Super-Dashboard)
*Thanks for you time*!
title: Super Store Data
subtitle: Historical sales of supermarket company
description:
The dataset is one of the historical sales of supermarket company which has recorded in 3 different branches for 3 months data.
[Visit Data Source](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/aungpyaeap/supermarket-sales) # But, I've changed the database a little Since I'll use this data only in a visualization work, I've a freedom to change the database to make my job easier and more visually appealing. **Note:** This data for the learning purposes, not for decision making.

### **Add four years to the date** Actually and for the first time, I worked with SQL not pandas. ```sql UPDATE superSales SET Order_date = DATEADD(YEAR, 4, Order_date) WHERE YEAR(Order_date) = 2019 ```

### **Add cities** Before: each branch has a unique identifier A, B, C Now: besides this id we also have a city name to be more clear about where the branch live. ```sql Update superSales set City = case Branch WHEN 'A' THEN 'Plymouth' WHEN 'B' THEN 'Bristol' WHEN 'C' THEN 'Glasgow' END; select City from superSales; ```

### The final product * [SuperDashboard on Streamlit](https://super-dashboard.streamlit.app/) * [Source Code on GitHub](https://github.com/mohamedyosef101/Super-Dashboard)
*Thanks for you time*!
